column4: you can buy shell access from lots of companies.  or you can find an old computer (even a 486 or Pentium) and run a Linux distribution on it, and enable an ssh server to which you can connect.
yeah i'm with that, i have a laptop and this machine i'm on now, but i have to keep windows on them for work - kinda lame huh
there is a version of Ubuntu you can run as a Windows task.  or you can run Linux off a bootable CD.
or just pick up a cheap Pentium III with decent memory and play with Linux on that.
